quest.name: To Storm-tossed Seas
journal: Urianger is patiently awaiting word that you are ready to depart.

You inform Urianger of your readiness to depart, and he exhorts you to consider a method of travel that will also facilitate breathing and movement beneath the waves. Rather than explain his proposal with wasteful words, however, your ever-enigmatic colleague bids you follow him to Sullen to behold his solution with your own eyes.

Urianger meets you at Sullen, and points out an island in the western part of the lake. It would seem that an underwater investigation of the foliage-covered landmass will soon open your eyes to its true nature.
You conduct an inspection of the submerged part of the island, and note some interesting peculiarities. Urianger waits above to hear word of your revelations.

The Isle of Ken is, as it turns out, an ancient fae being by the name of Bismarck. Urianger attempts to rouse the creature to action, but it takes the intervention of Feo Ul to convince Bismarck to bear you to the ocean's depths. Your journey to the Tempest has begun.

Bismarck deposits you on the sea floor, secure within an enormous dome of air created by its mighty breath. Your companions rise shakily to their feet, Urianger's face in particular a mask of relief...

※In the event that you leave the area, speak with Inewyl at Venmont Yards in Kholusia to return to the Tempest.

Releasing a long-held breath, Urianger announces your safe arrival in the Tempest. Suspecting that Emet-Selch cannot risk fleeing into the rift while the Exarch is his prisoner, he seems confident that the Ascian is to be found somewhere within this underwater realm. You have only to begin the search...
objectives: Investigate suspect rock formations beneath the water's surface.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I once said that I wanted to fight for Estinien─that I wanted to save him, not let him be sacrificed for a cause. And now I say the same to you.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Just so you know, I will not look kindly on any further attempts to leave us behind. We do this together.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Gods know you've spent enough time charging into danger on our behalf. It's only fair that we return the favor!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: There's nothing I can do to weaken the Light that's trapped inside you...but I'll do everything in my power to keep it from breaking free.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: If the Wardens' aether overwhelms you again, you will become a sin eater, so please, save your strength for when it really matters.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The volunteers who journeyed to Kholusia have all been safely returned to their homes. They've also assured us that they will do their best to hold the eaters at bay in our absence.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Thine affairs are in order? Then I shall unfold to thee my proposal.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Our destination is the ocean floor, yet our goal is not simply to arrive there. Nay, we must needs have the means to breathe and fight freely.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Thus would I petition the aid of one of the fae─a being with whom I have yet to meet face-to-face.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: ...Rather than waste words on explanation, I bid thee follow me unto the hamlet of Sullen, which lieth to the south and west. All will become abundantly clear, I promise thee.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: There, to the west. Canst thou discern the hump of an isle rising above the water?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: That foliage-covered mass hideth the key to our safe descent. Swim close and plunge thee beneath the surface. Thou shalt soon divine the reason for mine insistence.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: ...Though it be much to my shame, I can but flail and flounder where thou mayest glide as a fish. I shall board a boat to the island, and spare one and all the spectacle of mine inept strokes.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Ah, there you are. Once you've completed your underwater investigations, the path here leads to the top of the island.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text:
This lake is enormous...
Assuming my geography is correct, this would be the mirror of Silvertear back in the Source, although the size hardly compares.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: The locals call this the “Isle of Ken,” which I presume must refer to knowledge. Either that or someone was being awfully zealous about marking his territory.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Even seeing it up close, I'm still not sure what's so special about this island...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: If thou wouldst divine the secret of this isle, I prithee inspect the view from beneath the water's surface.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If you've solved Urianger's little mystery, then you can find him further up the slope. 'Twas all rather obvious to my eyes, though I concede I have an unfair advantage.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Two curved slabs of rock seem squeezed together here, giving the impression of giant stone eyelids.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Though it appears solid enough, the rock yields slightly under your touch. Was the surface gently shifting, or was it just your imagination...?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Well? What hast thou discerned?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I've discerned...that it's an ordinary island?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It reminds me of a certain primal...

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It's just like the Big One, yes, yes!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Truly? Naught could be further from the truth. According to the lore of the pixies, we are, even now, perched upon the back of an ancient fae entity...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Most perceptive. According to the lore of the pixies, we are, even now, perched upon the back of an ancient fae entity...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Hah! Thine impression is not inaccurate. According to the lore of the pixies, we are, even now, perched upon the back of an ancient fae entity...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Its name is “Bismarck.” Aye, the selfsame title by which we know the great feathered whale revered by the Vanu Vanu of the Source.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I would enlist its aid to bear us unto the deep, and thence banish the water with an airy sphere, alike in form to the domes which do shelter the hamlets 'neath the Ruby Sea.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Within its compass, we may move unencumbered, and defend ourselves when the hour of battle cometh, as it most surely shall. Now, I must needs ask for silence whilst I make my supplication...

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Travel to the Tempest?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Bismarck must be powerful indeed to create a dome of this size. I can only pray to whichever gods are listening that it continues to hold...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I remember being impressed by the domes of the Ruby Sea, but this makes them look like bubbles in a stream!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: With all that water out of the way, we'll be able to venture quite some distance. Emet-Selch must be hiding around here somewhere...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: This is amazing. I can't even see the surface!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I daresay Urianger endured much “playful” attention from the pixies to learn the lore of Bismarck. He is nothing if not a dedicated scholar.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text:
Haaa... Haaa...<gulp>
Full glad am I...that Bismarck was true to his word.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: We are arrived in the Tempest, safe and dry. 'Tis here that we shall find the lair of Emet-Selch, and, I believe, the imprisoned Exarch as well.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: For an Ascian alone, it is of course a trifling matter to flee unto the rift─yet I suspect such travel is nigh impossible with a mortal in one's custody.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Nay, he would not soon risk his prize when the Exarch's very body serveth as the key to the Crystal Tower and its powers of temporal transportation.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Thus am I all but certain that this underwater realm harboreth our friend and enemy both. We have but to find them.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In the event that you leave the area, speak with Inewyl at Venmont Yards in Kholusia to return to the Tempest.
